page.title: 18GT.HORKESLEY CRICKET CLUB
page.content: There has been a Cricket Club in Gt. Horkesley for more than 150 years though it has fluctuated in its activity.The present club was restarted in 1975 and now has 35 members with ages ranging from 14yrs-56yrs.The ground is near the Church.The members are very keen although they onlt play in the 3rd division of the Lancaster Garage League.They play 22 matches in the season and travel as far as Braintree to the west and Tattingstone rear Ipswich to the east.The matches are either Saturday or Sunday afternoon and either home or away.Each side bats for 40 overs. Alan Lake is the Club Secretary and Roger Mead,who is the land lord of the Rose and Crown Public House,is the Groundsman.Members wives support the team by spectating and preparing tea.
